item.title: Ukraine's last eastern strongholds hang on as Russia fights to take Donbas
item.description: Russia is pushing to take over all of eastern Ukraine's Donbas region, where one resident tells NPR that she feels her "life depends on how our guys at the front hold on."

item.title: Fighting between Thailand and Cambodia threatens Trump-brokered ceasefire
item.description: The fighting between Thailand and Cambodia could deal a serious blow to a ceasefire agreement brokered by President Donald Trump with help from Malaysia's Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim.

item.title: Honduras seeks arrest of ex-President Hernández after Trump pardon
item.description: Honduras' attorney general said Monday that he had ordered Honduran authorities and asked Interpol to execute a 2023 arrest order for Juan Orlando Hernández, pardoned by U.S. President Donald Trump.

item.title: Syria marks a year since Assad fled, but struggles to heal
item.description: Syria is struggling to heal a year after the Assad dynasty's repressive 50-year reign came to an end following 14 years of civil war that left the country battered and divided.

item.title: Christmas tree lighting held in Bethlehem for the first time since Gaza war began
item.description: People gathered in Bethlehem, in the Israeli occupied West Bank, to watch the lighting of the Christmas tree Saturday. It's the first time it's happened since the war in Gaza began two years ago.
